column4: I get permission denied when i try to move a file to/from my external hard drive. What should I do?
what filesystem
how do i check?
is it mounted?
yes i can mkdir in it also, i just cant transfer files
pastebin the output of the command: mount
i have no network connectivity on that box :(
I can run the command but not pastebin
mount should tell you the filesystem
vfat
what command do you run and what output do you get when you try to copy a file?
'mv /home/myusername/netfilesxxxxx.tar /wdext' OUTPUT: mv: cannot create regular file '/wdext/netfilesxxxxx.tar' : Permission denied
touch /wdext/touch_test
cannot touch: permission denied
ls -ld /wdext
drwxr-xr-x 25 root root 32768 2008-12-02 16:57 /wdext
how are you mounting this partition?  In fstab?  If so, with what options?
i did "sudo mount  /dev/sdc1 /wdext"
you want to use some options, so your user can write.  See ubottu (feel free to ask me if you're not sure what to do after reading what he sends you):
did you get a new prompt?  It's probably still moving
no, it moves by its self, i dont see a percentage thing or anything just the flashing _?
what do you mean "it moves by itself"?  mv has no progress bar.  Do you get a new prompt "linuxnoob@ubuntu$ " or whatever
then it's still moving.  How big is the file?
i meant like; is it moving if i dont see anything and i cant type into the prompt? but you answered my questoion by saying there is no progress bar; thanks :D
